website_summaries.verdict: If you just want a decent compact megazoom, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS5 is one of the better options thanks to a well-rounded feature set and very good photo quality at lower ISOs.
pros: Lots of features to experiment with

customer_reviews.title: nice camera, just don't get it wet.
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera, but it doesn't like getting wet. It was my fault, should have known better but I wanted to get a shot and in the process got splashed pretty good and the camera got pretty wet. Initially it stopped working at all but then came back to life, but the zoom doesn't work properly. It feels like it's got corrosion in it, obviously from getting wet. Keep it dry and you'll like this camera.
customer_reviews.author: lovetotravel

customer_reviews.title: Super, wonderful little camera!
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera for my horseback riding vacation to Scotland. It did not disappoint. I used the 'intelligent auto' mode and can't say enough good about it. The zoom and quality of photos was incredible! The image stabilization worked like a charm. The wide angle was fantastic for the vistas of the Highlands. The motion picture mode and continuous shooting features are also excellent. The software is very user friendly and the directions on how to use the features is excellent. I took one extra battery and a 16 GB card (didn't want to run out of room). Originally I only wanted to spend $150 or so. But am sooo happy I went the extra and purchased this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Passionate Dressage Diva

customer_reviews.title: Best for the $
customer_reviews.text: Had this camera for 5 month now. Excellent! This has the flexibility with many manual controls, great shots and some nice features. I'm not going in-depth for this review but I hounded the web prior to purchasing and still am a happy camper! Expecting many years of point and shoot use and easy traveling. Dial down most of the shots to 5 or 8 MP to conserve space; 12MP if I really want to edit the work later. Basically, if you want some nice features, don't crave GPS, need a flexible camera for all the occasions to easily slip into a bag or even a pocket... I doubt you'll find a better option for the money!
customer_reviews.author: JPmexico

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-zs5 is close to perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Panasonic Lumix DMC ZS5 is a great camera. Zero complaints. It is inexpensive, perfect weight, size, and ease of use. Most important, it produces sharply detailed photo images. Much improvement over Canon cameras I used in the past. Long battery life for rechargeable battery. Prior cameras ate up AA batteries quickly. Caveat: a little tricky to order a backup battery on the Internet. Need to be careful to buy the EXACT battery made by Panasonic for this exact model only, and definitely not one of the less expensive ones, none of which are exactly the same as the Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: judith

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little camera that does it all!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this camera and it's so intuitively designed, I was able to quickly discover its amazing ability to do everything from a wide screen format to a giant zoom to tight closeups - all from a small pocket size device. It works well in low light, easy to disable/enable flash, change settings, move into different modes, etc. Given the camera's size, the picture quality is also far better than I expected. Easy to download files from the card or the usb cable. The movie mode creates very high quality files. I will no longer be lugging around large cameras and lenses!
customer_reviews.author: carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic photos, but has a problem sucking dust into ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic photos, but has a problem sucking dust into the lens stack. Needs to be disassembled and cleaned periodically, or you get little dust bunny images on you pictures
customer_reviews.author: BigBossMan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have used Canon and Sony cameras in the past and can say that this camera gives much better pictures than either of the others in the same class. The macro is awesome and the details and colors are beautiful in the photos it produces. Also, having the additional zoom capabilities are a great feature that is difficult to find in other cameras in this class and price range. I would recommend this camera for those looking for a good point and shoot camera or someone looking to do a little more as it has many functions.
customer_reviews.author: JSK

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for Still Shots
customer_reviews.text: I really love the Panasonic Lumix Cameras. This one has lots of features, including utilizing JPEG format for older computers, instead of SDXC format for Windows 7 and above. The movies taken inside aren't as smooth and clear as my older DMC TZ7, but nevertheless, acceptable. I also take lots of outdoor shots and love the 12x feature. In general it's an easy camera to use. The hand-hold part is a bit difficult to deal with, but I'm getting used to it. This camera is a real find for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kihea

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful camera. Used for a medical office
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful camera. Used for a medical office. Auto-macro function enables anyone in the office to use the camera. Existing light adequate for photos. Flash not needed. I have five of these cameras.
customer_reviews.author: JGB

customer_reviews.title: i really liked this camera a lot
customer_reviews.text: but it broke after a few months. the lens projects/retracts when it turns on and off, and i guess the motor died. one day it stopped focusing, and then the lens would no longer move, and then there was an error message on the display. (i don't remember exactly what it said now.) i just so happened to be in another country when this happened so it did this at one of the worst possible times too.
customer_reviews.author: laurencg

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I has a much older Panasonic with a 6x zoom but wanted an update. The Optical stabilizer on my old camera wasn't impressive. I always got blur when using the zoom. Not so with this camera! The zoom is amazing! I lowered the pixel count to 9 and the zoom increases. Amazingly clear zoom shots! I have noticed some fuzziness in night shots, but I have never used anything but the auto mode. The reaction to my pictures is overwhelming! Everyone thinks I'm a pro and have a $$$$$ camera!
customer_reviews.author: Robyn P

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is really my second camera. Loved the first one. Pictures and everything was great. With my first took it to the beach where it ended up getting a little sand on the lens and that lead it to start having problems with the auto focus and zoom then it stopped working all together. Because I really loved the camera I decided to try another (this time avoiding the sand) and so far it has not disappointed me in the quality of the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Point and Shoot!
customer_reviews.text: Well, here I am years later reviewing this camera which was a Christmas gift for our niece from ours. While it worked just great, it's rarely used now thanks to the iPhone :)
customer_reviews.author: ErikGoBlue

customer_reviews.title: versatile camera
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this camera, which I have had for a month. On a recent flight I used "aerial". The pictures are really terrific, zoomed. In time I will experiment with shutter and aperture priority as I have not done that yet. The only complaint I have is that when I grab it with my right hand and take a snapshot, my hand pushes buttons that I do not want pushed. Have to use 2 hands to avoid that problem.
customer_reviews.author: sea tern

customer_reviews.title: A good value
customer_reviews.text: The Panasonic ZS5 may be the best in its class. Some of the features are not intuitive, so you may have to consult the owner's manual a few times, but once you figure it out, it's not too bad. The only real downside I have experienced is it does not perform well in low light. But overall, it's a very nice camera for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Scap

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Small Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this camera, it gives me the Zoom range I like because, we do a lot of Museum, Gardens, and Zoos visiting. With the Zoom range I can go from a Close-up Flower, to a Bird up on a tree. The only problem I have with it is, when the sun is behind me, this wipes out the viewing window. I hear a hood for viewing is available for the back which allows holding up to your eye. The only thing I can recommend as a caution is if you think most of your use is outside, then consider a Camera with both options. john
customer_reviews.author: John M. Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Nice little camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to replace my Nikon point and shoot. After reading lots of reviews all over the web and understanding that model change time was coming, I decided that this camera was an excellent choice. Great price, very good speed of writing, and excellent optics. I use it in my school classroom, and it will join my Canon Rebel T2i this summer on vacation. I don't really know which camera I will use more. This one is pretty good for standard size pics.
customer_reviews.author: Barry N. Wilensky

customer_reviews.title: great point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: I have had a lot of point and shoot cameras and this one really fits the bill for me. There are lots of preset options, plus you have options to focus it on your own, which is rare to find in a point and shoot. It's a bit bulky, but still fits in my pocket so I can take it everywhere I go with my two sons. If you are looking for a good point and shoot that gives you a bit more control and a decent photo, this might be the camera for you.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fuchs

customer_reviews.title: Lumix DMC-ZS5
customer_reviews.text: I've been a DSLR user for seven years, but after a recent vacation was interested in something more compact. I began researching the category of travel zoom cameras and found several good candidates. I wanted the flexibility of manual settings, a long zoom, good macro focus, and good low light response. This seems to be a great combination of all those. The solid feel of the camera puts me in mind of some of the classic 35mm range finders I used decades ago. It's all I wanted and I'm still exploring more its features. I'll still use my DSLR, but won't have to lug it around on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Rheath

customer_reviews.title: a review 3 years after purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera over 3 years ago, and I still use it on almost all the trips I take and often daily use as well, and I started to take my d-SLR less and less often once I got this camera. The lens is very good, and the battery lasts long enough (easily over 100 frames).
customer_reviews.author: Topper Shopper

customer_reviews.title: The camera was in very good condition and worked as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The camera was packaged very well and the battery had a partial charge. The camera was in very good condition and worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: s s

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera with great angle lens for its size. We take pics of apartments and condos and it can come to terms with most every sized room.
customer_reviews.author: rhm

customer_reviews.title: Persistant shadow
customer_reviews.text: I liked this camera very much for 18 months, then a mark appeared on the pictures as if there were dust or water spot on the lens. I thought it an anomaly so ordered a second one. Voila Same problem the first time that one was used. They continue to get good ratings, but twice burned... I'm switching brands!
customer_reviews.author: VZ

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these. I Dropped em, worked em hard, Gave one away and had one stolen Keep one on me at all times. Good at micro & macro enough said...
customer_reviews.author: A. T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great quick pix camera
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Panasonic Lumix that I've purchased. The first was stolen. I love the sharpness of the images and the color clarity. The marriage of Panasonic and Leica is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: C. T. Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera, I wanted the black body w/it's sleek look. It is a little heavier than my previous point n shoot but it is well worth it to have the options it gives you. The price was great for what was given. I took it out of the box, didn't have time to read anything and took pics at our Christmas party. They came out pretty good for not knowing anything about the camera and it was dark in the room but the quality was better than my other camera.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not bad it is well made and does a decent job.
customer_reviews.author: Ocean

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because it had very good reviews. The picture quality is pretty good when there is a lot of light, but in low-light conditions there is a lot of noise in the images. Just zoom in to any dark portion of an image and you'll see what I mean. Also, I don't know why they use the proprietary QuickTime format for video instead of standard MPEG. QuickTime eats up too much space, and most programs can't deal with it properly.
customer_reviews.author: Curley Joe

customer_reviews.title: Best P&S camera I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I purchase supplies for a mid size construction contractor, and this is the best point and shoot camera I have purchased to date. While it is not up to par with a more expensive DSLR, it is a super camera for the price this is at.
customer_reviews.author: Zaphod

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, super manual capability
customer_reviews.text: As a relative newbie in photography I am enjoying the full range of zoom and the auto/manual capabilites of this camera...Being the first camera I have owned in over 20 years, I find this to offer one of the best values in small camera arena...
customer_reviews.author: JTM

customer_reviews.title: Lumix camera
customer_reviews.text: I loved this camera but it didn't last very long ---- Not the camera fault though . I went into the ocean with it in my swim trunks pocket to my dissapointment . SO I ordered another on , this time getting the next one up on the scale I got the DMC-ZS8 . Its good but I really miss the ZS5 , I was just getting used to it .
customer_reviews.author: Harold

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix DS5
customer_reviews.text: You get plenty of bang for your buck with this model and you save a few dollars if you don't need the GPS feature of the DS-7. It has amazing HD video and burst capability and the 25mm wide angle and 300 zoom lens is an awesome combination. This camera gets more use than my SLR now days as it takes photos using Aperture or Shutter priority and Manual modes.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix from Big Value Inc.
customer_reviews.text: I had reservations when ordering this Used Like New item. I previously owned this exact camera. The package arrived quickly, there was no way to determine that this item was not brand new. All functions are like new, the photos come out with great clarity as do the videos. I highly recommend this camera and vendor and am very pleased with my purchase. Richard
customer_reviews.author: RDB

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera for a trip to Disney World. My wife took the majority of the pictures in auto mode and they turned out great. Other members of our family have a much more expensive camera and, in my opinion, ours turned out better. The different modes are easy to switch too as well. In many places a flash could not be used, but the picture still turned out great in the night time mode. We would definitely recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: tstanley79

customer_reviews.title: 12 zoom sweet
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera It is shirt pocketable. A little heavy but easy fit and heavey is good for holding. Saturation is a little weak. Software is somewhere between poor and unusable. Pictures do not display properly. 25-300 is fun. Very versitile. Maybe too many selections to set up quickly. MY PET PEEVE: Every camera needs an optical viewfinder. When one uses reading glasses it doesn't matter how big or good a digital screen is, it's not possible to see the scene and the screen. Recommend this camera although a bezel adjustment like some of the new cameras would be nice but they are under 5X which is a no go.
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix DMC ZS5
customer_reviews.text: Seems to offer lots of features plus quality. i usually don't take much time reading manuals--so i have been able to do the basic stuff and am pleased so far. when i want to figure out how to do something that's not obvious, then it's a bit difficult to quickly find and understand how to accomplish what i'm looking to do. would i buy it again? absolutely. a great feature/price point.
customer_reviews.author: jdw

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Digial "Point and Shoot" Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, particularly the zoom capabilities. And I do like the rechargeable battery design (versus the AA format found with many cameras in this class). I do wish there were more printed instructions on using the camera -- since it seems to have far more capabilities than I am accustomed to. But unfortunately, it does not come with an instructions manual -- other than the "fast start" type.
customer_reviews.author: Paul E.

customer_reviews.title: Lumix zs5
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera 14 months ago to replace an Olympus. Noticed a couple months ago that there were squiggly lines in the picture when using the zoom. Researched the problem and found there is dust on the lenses. Notified Panasonic and was told it could be replaced with a refurbished camera for an additional fee of $192.00. Will be looking for another camera but not a Lumix.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS5
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for, long zoom for birding/wildlife, yet compact enough to fit (barely) in pocket. Only thing I don't care for is Panasonic software - a lot more complicated/squirrely than the Canon software I was used to. So I am using Picasa 3 instead for taking pictures off camera and into my laptop and that works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rdurof

customer_reviews.title: great camera!!!!
customer_reviews.text: bought this to replace our old point-n-shoot. only had for about a week, and love it. there are a ton of settings, and scene options. the zoom is amazing. great picture quality. gave it 4 stars because of price, i paid $210 in Aug 2010, and I'm sure the price will continue to drop. You more than likely will need read the manual, as i need to do, to fully understand how to use all the different settings and scene modes.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Irvin

customer_reviews.title: love my camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera, it is compact enough to carry in your pocket, yet has zoom to really get good pictures at sporting events. The only small downside for me, is that you have to take the battery out to charge it. If you could charge it in the camera, it would be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: shane

customer_reviews.title: LumixZS5
customer_reviews.text: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS5 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD. 12 Megapixels and 12X zoom are a good combination to give great pictures at any distance. Most of my limited use of the product was over the Christmas season so lots of great portrait style photos. All in all very pleased .
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Still testing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because of the 16x feature which I am happy with. So far the macro is disappointing. I'm hoping it improves when I get used to the camera. It is not as easy to work with as I had hoped. As a result I leave it on automatic most of the time. I have not taken a lot of pics in low light but the ones I have came out better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: traveler

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS5 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera, fits in pocket easily. Awesome zoom. Computer program that comes with it makes storing pictures a pleasure. Would definitely buy this camera again.
customer_reviews.author: EBIEV

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing is when recording a video at a place that is exceptionally loud such as Electric Daisy Carnival, the audio quality of the camera lowers itself to a really muffled sound and it is quite annoying if you're an audiofile. Other than that, picture are good.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian B

customer_reviews.title: First digital camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my first digital camera. My daughter brought one and she highly recommended the camera. I am higly pleased with all aspects of the camera. My husband who is a tech phobia loves this camera. Might have to buy another just so he and I do not fight over who is taking pictures.
customer_reviews.author: gwalsh

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. I like the automatic settings and the ease of setting your own exposures and f-stop.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Hackler

customer_reviews.title: Good but with dead battery
customer_reviews.text: I received this camera in excellent condition- it looks good and works perfectly - but the battery that was included was completely dead and had to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Zorrilla

customer_reviews.title: Good solid camera for every day use
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality of the pictures and it is very easy to upload pics to the pc... the only con is that the electronic zoom is very difficult to control. It seems to be an "all or nothing" zoom... still working on understanding that.
customer_reviews.author: faeryfriendz

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera, Excellent Resolution, Better ZOOOOM!
customer_reviews.text: This camera by fair away, beats any Sony Cybershot series W. , the zoom its excellent, and the image quality its very good even on low light conditions. i would recomend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Alkamir

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfull camera
customer_reviews.text: I looked at many cameras before making this purchase. Panasonic has always been great with electronics and you can't beat Leica for a great lense. Like a combo made in heaven. The picture quality is amaizing. The camera is easy to use. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: BZ

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: really like this camera.Easy to use,reliable and nice and small,great!!Has a lot of features that I would never have thought to use but they are cool to use and I am not a camera nut.
customer_reviews.author: dominick prodoti

customer_reviews.title: Incorrectly shipped item.
customer_reviews.text: The camera is fine, but it did not include the right battery charger. It was more trouble to send the incorrect one back than it was worth.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: Totally satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The best camera I ever had, period. Very good auto mode, and simple scene modes to fit difficult pictures
customer_reviews.author: Juancentro

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding camera
customer_reviews.text: The Pamasonic is outstanding. I have a Nikon D300 and the Panasonic takes almost the same quality picture. The lens is sharp and the equivalent of a 25mm-300mm lens. Really top quality.
customer_reviews.author: kevin dwyer

customer_reviews.title: great pictures
customer_reviews.text: The lense and zoom are amazing you cant go wrong. Highly recommended, very easy to use takes great pictures thanks
customer_reviews.author: David J Fischer

customer_reviews.title: great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my husband and he loves it. It has a great zoom and is very small and easy to travel with.
customer_reviews.author: Casey C. Alvey

customer_reviews.title: Lumix DMC-ZS5
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a nice fit for me because of its ease of use and nice picture quality. I like the mechanism for the 12x zoom. So far, I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: organizer957

customer_reviews.title: Second time around
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera, lots of fun and takes beautiful pictures. I bought it again, my first (older model) fell in the water. This camera is not water proof.
customer_reviews.author: bonsangue66

customer_reviews.title: great camera!
customer_reviews.text: got it as a present for the wife and she loves it. camera works great and it was actually cheaper on amazon than at retail.
customer_reviews.author: martianmisfit

customer_reviews.title: NEVER buy this camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera 6 months ago. within that time i have had to get a replacement 3 times. And as of today (6 months after buying it) I have to return it again. It keeps getting an odd black dot in all the pictures. There is nothing on the lens or inside. It just continually has this weird black dot show up. I will never buy this camera again. If you want a great camera dont buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie K

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for amateur usage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to use occasionally at events and parties, basically amateur usage. It does exactly what it should. The quality is great, when uploading to the computer it is clear even zoomed in. The video is also good quality, although there is no light available for video use, so only use it in well lite areas. Can't complain about it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Edward Ahrens

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: My third Lumix camera and the best one yet. Has a wide range of manual settings and the Intelligent Auto feature for fine results without much effort.
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: Lumix DMC-ZS5 Camera
customer_reviews.text: The Camera was a grat purchase and takes great clear photos it also very easy to use.I would recomend this camera without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Hartmut Voelker

customer_reviews.title: Lumix DMC-ZS5 LCD Screen
customer_reviews.text: Very good camera but it is difficult to see properly the LCD screen when you are taking photos in the sun. Zoom and video are excellents.
customer_reviews.author: PSLB

customer_reviews.title: Dont think BUY
customer_reviews.text: Really doesnt need to many words. Do the research, this camera is the best in this price range. Dont worry about the lack of 100s of reviews on amazon. More buy more review.
customer_reviews.author: Efem Esi

customer_reviews.title: Horrible display image
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this camera. It had a horrible LCD display and the video it took was terrible quality. With all the great sub compact cameras out there I would strongly reccomend finding another one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Wop36

product_meta.title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS5 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackFROM THE MANUFACTURER


 The Lumix DMC-ZS5 features a 25mm ultra wide-angle* 12x optical zoom f/3.3-4.9 Leica DC Vario-Elmar lens (35mm camera equivalent: 25-300mm). Incorporating Panasonic's advanced optical technologies, this lens system is comprised of 10 elements in 8 groups, with 2 ED (Extra Low Dispersion) lenses and 2 aspherical lenses / 3 aspherical surfaces while preserving compactness. This lens system enables a remarkable 25 to 300mm range of focal length in this compact body. The powerful zoom of the DMC-ZS5can be freely controlled even when shooting motion images. Inheriting the fine rendering and outstanding quality of the Leica Elmar lens, this easy-to-carry camera delivers beautiful images any time, any place.
* Converted to standard 35mm camera equivalent, at the maximum wide position. 

Lumix DMC-ZS5 Highlights 



Powerful 12x Optical Zoom
The DMC-ZS5 features a powerful 12x optical zoom lens (35mm camera equivalent: 25-300mm). This gives you highly natural expressions from people and animals that you can't get close to. It is also available in movie recording with the mechanism designed to minimize the noise of auto focusing or zooming. And its slim, compact, pocket-sized body can easily go wherever you do for both everyday snapshots and traveling. 

25mm Ultra Wide-angle Lens
The 25mm ultra wide-angle lens has about twice the shooting area as a standard 35mm lens. This enhances all kinds of shooting situations, like when you're photographing a group of people at an indoor party or shooting a large structure or sweeping landscape while traveling. 

16x Intelligent Zoom / 23.4x Extra Optical Zoom
Thanks to the newly incorporated Intelligent Resolution technology, the Intelligent Zoom is available with the DMC-ZS5 which extends the zoom ratio by approx. 1.3x maintaining the picture quality even combining a digital zoom. This means the 12x optical can virtually extend to 16x equivalent. Furthermore, the Extra Optical Zoom function that extends zoom power to 23.4x* by using the center part of the large CCD to bring subjects even closer.
*At 3-megapixel resolution or less. 


Sonic Speed AF
The Sonic Speed AF system in the DMC-ZS5 has a maximum speed of approx. 0.35 second (wide-end) / 0.41 second (tele-end) for auto focusing. It includes numerous re-engineering enhancements, including a higher-speed actuator, optimized algorithms and parallel software processing. The result is fast and accurate AF performance. You can quickly get moving subjects in focus, such as when you're shooting sports scenes. 

POWER O.I.S. (Optical Image Stabilizer) Shake Detection
Just about everyone has had the experience of taking a photo at night and hoping to capture all the memories and beauty, only to be disappointed at the poor result. The POWER O.I.S. (Optical Image Stabilizer)* nearly doubles the hand-shake correction power of conventional MEGA O.I.S. You get bright photos without blurring even from handheld shooting at slow shutter speeds. Panasonic's accumulated optical technologies, the MEGA O.I.S. has been incorporated into Lumix from the early stage of digital camera development. This helped show all digital camera users the absolute need for hand-shake compensation, and led to its prevalence throughout the industry. And now, Panasonic has worked on the low-frequency vibration hand-shake component, which is physically generated when pressing the shutter button or when shooting at night with a slow shutter speed.


*The POWER O.I.S. is automatically turned on in the iA Mode and can be turned on or off in the P/A/S/M Mode or some Scene Modes.
feature_bullets: The DMC-ZS5 features a powerful 12x optical zoom lens (35mm camera equivalent: 25-300mm)
The 25mm ultra wide-angle lens has about twice the shooting area as a standard 35mm lens
The Intelligent Zoom with the DMC-ZS5 extends the zoom ratio by approx. 1.3x maintaining the picture quality even combining a digital zoom
The Sonic Speed AF system in the DMC-ZS5 has a maximum speed of approx. 0.35 second (wide-end) / 0.41 second (tele-end) for auto focusing
The POWER O.I.S. (Optical Image Stabilizer) nearly doubles the hand-shake correction power of conventional MEGA O.I.S
